intro: Sphaeralcea weberbaueri, commonly known as the Weberbauer's globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, characterized by its showy, showy yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in desert or arid environments. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, dry seeds. Sphaeralcea weberbaueri is adapted to hot, dry climates and is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance.
